item.title: UK interest rates: Bank of England lowers rates to 3.75%
item.description: The Bank of England’s Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has cut interest rates from 4% to 3.75%

item.title: A quarter of a million more pensioners in poverty after state pension age rises – will it go higher?
item.description: When the state pension age rose to 66, the percentage of 65-year-olds in income poverty more than doubled, new research suggests
